title.narrative: Giant Grouper Aquaculture in Vietnam and the Philippines

description.narrative: Groupers form the basis of the live reef food-fish trade in the south-east Asian region and is a high-value, fast-growing grouper species with significant aquaculture potential. Commercial production of juveniles has not yet been achieved in partner countries of this region, due to lack of knowledge on the species’ maturation and spawning behaviour, and low survival rates of larvae. This project aims to build the foundation skills and knowledge for establishing sustainable hatchery production of giant grouper in the Philippines and Vietnam. The objectives include developing reliable captive-breeding technologies to close the life cycle, including exploring the potential of genetics and biotechnology to control reproduction. Activities will build capacity in all aspects of sustainable giant grouper aquaculture, and be of immediate benefit to aquaculture farmers.
